replies.body: Riot, April Fools Day was yesterday, I think you forgot to take Dunkmaster Ivern off the patch notes.

you're an animal, dude says he doesn't like a skin line and you pop off and you lose your shit lmao

I 100% though there had to be more comments because for someone to just say that based on the two previous comments makes absolutely no sense. After looking for a "show more comments" or something like that button and not finding it, I'm pretty shocked lol.

I like how Demolish, Overgrowth and Ultimate Hunter were "Bad", but I thought those were most of the times the best runes of their tree. Well now I think they are busted LOL.{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

Demolish was fine, I'm not entirely sure why they decided to change it considering it's already very effective at its intended purpose — allowing uninhibited tanks to be a split-push threat.

Overgrowth was bad because it just gave such a paltry amount of actual HP — the stacking component is only +3 max HP for every 8 minions, and tanks usually aren't going to go be around more than maybe 350 minions in a match if they and their team are playing at all smartly. Meanwhile, even 2.5% of 4000 HP is only 100. It had some niche cases to allow a few tank junglers to get and activate early Warmog's, but it was still a really low amount of extra health until really late. I'm not sure these changes really fix that problem, either.

Ultimate Hunter was terrible in comparison to Ravenous for damage-dealers, Ingenious for active item-users (e.g. Glacial Augment builds), and Relentless — well, it's a high amount of out-of-combat movement speed, so it's great for roamers, but not easy to really feel the value of unless you compare it very deliberaly. In comparison, 15% internal CDR on your ultimate, when most of the champions going into Domination end up at high CDR values anyways, and people at lower skill levels can rarely coordinate around punishing ults being on cooldown, just doesn't give that much value.
I didn't think Demolish was weak/strong so much as sometimes it was the ONLY choice that your champ could actually USE in that row.
Demolish and overgrowth, yeah, but ultimate hunter was always super week

Overgrowth was and will still be incredibly garbage. Your average player might have got 150 hp out of it by end game and that's on a  high hp tank. Meanwhile some of these other rune options readily give out 30 adaptive force (14.4 AD or 24 AP if I'm not mistaken). The gold difference in value there is staggering, adaptive force gives ~504 gold value for an AD user and the overgrowth gave 400 gold value... Now it will give 470 ish. Still under powered unless you've got over 4k hp. Which at that point few champs need 180 more hp.

I should mention we're comparing 500+ gold of value from some runes available 10-15 minutes sooner than the 400-470 gold value you get from overgrowth around the 30 minute mark.

It is a back end loaded rune that adds very little value to any situation for any class.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 
Jarvan IV has a dunk and gets hextech skin

Ivern has no dunk and gets a dunkmaster skin

All you had to do was swap the two themes guys :(
Oh I would have purchased the crap out of a hextech Ivern skin, immediately, no matter the price. I'll pass on the Dunkmaster skin, just seems lazy
Yall know yall are wrong for that Mundo buff

I honestly wish Mid Lane Morgana would stop being hit so much. I'm not saying she shouldn't be able to be a support champion (because her kit wholeheartedly supports it), but the fact that she started as a Mid Laner and got forcefully shoved into the Support role bothers me so much. And it only feels like Riot doesn't WANT her to be a Mid Laner at all, seeing as everytime her Mid Lane seems to pick back up to any reasonable level, they nerf her again. I just genuinely want to know why that is.

Wait that wits end change made it in wtf riot whyyy no bruiser is going to take this your just fucking on hit champions also WHY ARE YOU MAKING IT A BRUISER ITEM they just got a new item, on hit already has a small number of items so why are you making it worse just why you did not give a reason for this either for doing this.

More attack speed, more late game damage, and has healing...
How is this a nerf for on hit champions again?

the mr shred from wit's end was the only reason you'd really take it at all. it was a great item on magic damage on-hit champs like {{champion:10}} {{champion:145}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:518}} & now it's just a weird niche item..? for fighters for some reason, as if they were benefitting the most from it. {{champion:145}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:10}} say hi.
imo they should've kept the mr drain but made it just shred rather than siphon, maybe even lowering the -30 mr to ~25? i had like 100 mr on kai'sa like..? i could at least understand it if fighters took it then but now it's just a badly niche on-hit item.
Azir never built wit’s end.  His soldiers proc ability effects, but mostly no on-hit effects.  The only exception I know of is hail of blades
That's because Hail of Blades isn't triggered on-hit, it's triggered on attack.
Never play Azir on my team

They literally took away the bruiser aspect of it (stealing magic resist) and increased the attack speed damage and gave it sustain.... This is a huge buff to on hit lol (im looking at you {{champion:10}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:96}}  )

they remove the fighter passive & now proudly say it's a fighter item.. would hate to see it.
as for on-hit buff, i tried it on kai'sa on the pbe & it's anticlimactic at best

This week we added more damage to
Dr. Mundo
Azir
Wit's End
Ghost Poro
Zombie Ward
Cut Down

I will say I like the changes to some of the tanks (focusing on utility and availability of abilities rather than just, slap some damage on that). And I like the buff on cinderhulk, but I don't feel like it'll be on that impact without the same improvements to bami's. Reason being, that tank junglers generally have slower clears, especially on single monsters (like gromp) in the early game. When you have champs that are clearing rapidly at the top of the ranked ladder (Rek'Sai, Karthus, Vi, Udyr) AND have decent gank power to boot, it feels like most tank junglers don't really have a place in the meta (aside from Sej and Nunu, who have pretty good clear speeds because of their abilities having that single target damage).
They took out a lot of damage from Wit's End if you factor in the lack of MR shred.
less damage early but evens out late and  tons more sustain. To Kog/vayne/irelia, it's a major plus.

I normally don't post on these, but there is one change I don't agree with.

new:OUCH Damage from champions further than 900 units away is reduced by 15% 

ARAM is already receiving bans, why should champions whose kit focuses and has strength in longer ranges get punished for playing correctly? 

I think a solid compromise would be: Damage from champions further than 900 units away is reduced by 15% for abilities that aren't their ultimate ability. This still helps versus Jayce Q, Nidalee Q, Xerath Q, Varus Q, etc. But it doesn't completely gut champions that actually rely on their range. 

If left as is, it will just feel like you're getting punished for no reason with a 15% damage nerf if you're playing a champion who only has longer range abilities with weaknesses when they're engaged on.

Does this patch possibly fix the random lag spikes that have been happening to a lot of people? Over the last two weeks I've been encountering very brief 1 second frame drops/packet losses and I was hoping this resolved it. It severely impacts some games and I've been holding off on ranked since I noticed the issue. I've tested my internet and my connection, neither of those have had any issue. A person I was playing a game with also experienced a spike at the exact same time as me, which further leads me to believe it something up with the client/server. Please inform!
Where are the Riven and Vayne nerf? I hate seeing them the most top tier
NA is the only place where Riven is any sort of issue (hell, elsewhere she's actually not doing great), so Riot is apparently chalking it up to a regional thing and not touching her.

Personally I'm sad about the Wit's change, but mostly because this probably means I won't be able to play Wit's End Nautilus and somehow top the damage charts on my team any more. To be fair though, that probably shouldn't have been possible in the first place.

I feel like that could still work. If anything they're pushing the item more towards tanky melee champs and away from ranged carries. Maybe you won't deal as much damage but it still sounds like a good item for... whatever it is you're doing.
4 second nerf to sylas e cooldown: God Bless! That ability was way overtuned

The fact that you guys got rid of the poro kills me inside. I used that guy for EVERYTHING. Having it just exist as an extra 60 seconds on a ward just kills this completely for me.

I didn't even care for the bonus damage it would give, it was just a way to always have a buddy spot for me when I was invading or even just defending my own jungle, but now I can't do that anymore and simply must purchase wards.

It honestly was very strong for information, busted even because it was free vision when you needed it, and without the need of a ward, just people who play this game are all in or not in at all. For me, as a person who actually played the game, I relied on this guy to give us the intel we would need, and then he would alarm the team if someone ran by... but, it is dead now. TBH, this whole part of the tree is pretty trash now. It was cool to have a unique benefit, but now its just the same trash.

You truly are a ghost now. RIP Poro. 4/3/2019. I will never forget you, buddy. I even nicknamed him after my dog who passed a year ago because he was just like my dog, he did nothing but make a lot of noise when someone visited the house. {{summoner:31}} Poro Toss, right out the window.

i think it is pretty disrespectful to the league community that riot does things like say urgot is op we need to nerf him, so they nerf him... then buff him... then nerf him again. first make up your mind, second all this effort could go to champions that actually need work or reworks. this patch team is a joke they change their mind every other week on who they want to be meta

Reworks are done by a different team than the balance team. Duh.
Urgot WAS OP, but then they realized they overnerfed him, so they buffed him, but that buff was too much, so they had to nerf to compensate. That's not disrespectful, that's game balance. 
They're not trying to make anyone meta. They're just balancing. That's their job.
I get that Dark seal was a bit strong but now it's completely gutted. Seer percentages alone it was Nerfed 33% initial ap and 43% sellback value yikes..  RIP Dark Seal.
